snippet: A study has infused the field of cardiovascular medicine with optimism, as scientists are calling for similarly rigorous studies of other popular diets.
abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine shows for first time that Mediterranean--high in olive oil, fish or nuts--diet can have effect as powerful as drugs in preventing heart attacks, strokes and deaths from cardiovascular disease; study has infused field of cardiovascular medicine with optimism and scientists are calling for similarly rigorous studies of other popular diets.
lead_paragraph: A study has infused the field of cardiovascular medicine with optimism, as scientists are calling for similarly rigorous studies of other popular diets.

headline.main: Experts Want More Studies of Diet’s Role for the Heart
headline.print_headline: Experts Want More Studies Of Diet’s Role For the Heart
